quiz.question: What is the distress signal for a vessel not under command?
quiz.truth_answer: Two all-round red lights in vertical line plus two balls or similar shapes in vertical line.

quiz.question: A vessel is considered 'underway' when:
choices: It is made fast to the shore
It is not at anchor, or made fast to the shore, or aground

quiz.question: What sound signal does a pilot vessel make?
quiz.truth_answer: One prolonged blast at intervals not exceeding 2 minutes

quiz.question: What lights does a vessel not under command show?
quiz.truth_answer: Two all-round red lights in vertical line where best seen; two balls or similar shapes in vertical line where best seen; when making way, sidelights and sternlight.

quiz.question:
A vessel intending to overtake another in a narrow channel or fairway on her port side

Vessel A: power-driven vessel Vessel B: power-driven vessel Area: Narrow channel Vessel A is intending to overtake vessel B on her port side
A vessel of less than 20 metres in length may use the inshore traffic zone when:
choices: When en route to a port within the zone

quiz.question: In a crossing situation, if the stand-on vessel finds it necessary to take action, she should, if circumstances permit, not alter course to port for a vessel on her:
What is the difference between 'not under command' and 'restricted in ability to manoeuvre'?
quiz.truth_answer: Not under command means unable to avoid collision by action of her own; restricted in ability to manoeuvre means that she may be required to take action to avoid collision but cannot do so with certainty.

quiz.question:
Relative bearing of overtaking vessel is 180°

Vessel A: power-driven vessel Vessel B: power-driven vessel Area: On the high seas Visibility: Good (Vessels in sight of one another) Vessel A is overtaking vessel B Vessel A is astern of vessel B (relative bearing 180°)
A give-way vessel should, as far as possible, take early and substantial action to:
choices: Pass close to the other vessel
Cross ahead of the other vessel

quiz.question: When does Rule 11 apply?
quiz.truth_answer: Rule 11 applies to vessels in sight of one another.

quiz.question: What sound signal does a power-driven vessel making way through the water sound in restricted visibility?
quiz.truth_answer: One prolonged blast at intervals of not more than 2 minutes
